page.title: 06THE CLOCK HOUSE IN DUNMOW
page.content: We visited the{Clock House}in The Causeway,it is the oldest brick house in Dunmow.It dates back to 1580 and many parts have been added.Mr Rowell has lived there for 38 years,it was sold by Lady Warwick for Â£1100 in 1920 Anne Line was the housekeeper in Clock House when it was known as Gaston Lodge she used to hide priests in priest holes .She was caught by the Protestants who in those days didn't like Catholic priests.They sent Ann to prison where they tried her and hung her in 1601 she came back and haunted Clock House until she was made a saint recently,but she came back and haunted Clockhouse. At the top of the Clock house there is a clock dated back to 1651,there is only one other clock like this which is at Dover Castle.In the old cellars we found lots of interesting artefacts
